status: Good Service Bartholomew Sikes, 1898 Victorian, was a well-known British stage performer and vaudeville artist. He was known for his comedic performances and his ability to connect with audiences. Sikes' career spanned several decades, and he performed in numerous theatres across the United Kingdom and internationally. He was particularly popular during the late 19th and early 20th centuries, a period often referred to as the Golden Age of Music Hall. His performances typically involved a combination of singing, dancing, and humorous monologues or sketches. Sikes was also recognized for his distinctive style and stage presence, which contributed to his lasting appeal. His contributions to the entertainment industry helped shape the landscape of popular British theatre during his time. All clear.
